bill_title: to authorize sheriffs to collect fees for expenses incurred in executing court orders.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to authorize sheriffs to collect fees for expenses incurred in executing court orders. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 7-12 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Any sheriff may collect fees to recover reasonable expenses that are incurred as a result of executing an order of the court. The party who initiated the court action shall pay the fees and may pursue any available judicial remedy to recover such costs from the other parties involved in the action. The party who initiated the court action may appeal to the judge who issued the order for a reduction or waiver of all fees based upon ability to pay or reasonableness of expenses. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.016 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to authorize sheriffs to collect fees for expenses incurred in executing court orders. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That subdivision (24) of § 7-12-18 be amended to read as follows: (24) If personal property is taken by the sheriff on execution or warrant of attachment and applied in the satisfaction of the debt without sale, the same percentage on the appraised value of the property as in the case of a sale and any actual costs incurred in executing the duties of sheriff under this chapter . BILL HISTORY 1/17/98 First read in Senate and referred to State Affairs. S.J. 69 1/23/98 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/28/98 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/28/98 State Affairs Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 9, NAYS 0. S.J. 226

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to authorize sheriffs to collect fees for expenses incurred in executing court orders. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That subdivision (24) of § 7-12-18 be amended to read as follows: (24) If personal property is taken by the sheriff on execution or warrant of attachment and applied in the satisfaction of the debt without sale, the same percentage on the appraised value of the property as in the case of a sale and all reasonable and necessary costs and expenses incurred in executing the duties of sheriff under this chapter to the extent that such costs and expenses are not otherwise reimbursed . BILL HISTORY 1/17/98 First read in Senate and referred to State Affairs. S.J. 69 1/23/98 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/28/98 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/28/98 State Affairs Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 9, NAYS 0. S.J. 226 1/29/98 State Affairs Hog Housed. 1/30/98 Senate Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 33, NAYS 0. S.J. 267 2/2/98 First read in House and referred to Local Government. H.J. 354 2/12/98 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/12/98 Local Government Do Pass, Passed, AYES 12, NAYS 0. H.J. 598 2/14/98 House of Representatives Deferred to another day. H.J. 703 2/17/98 Motion to Amend, Passed. H.J. 700 2/17/98 House of Representatives Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 60, NAYS 8. H.J. 701
